meanings.sent1: The flowers in the garden are alive and colorful.
meanings.sent2: The forest was alive with the sounds of birds chirping.
meanings.sent3: The party was so alive that even the walls seemed to dance.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were so alive with excitement, they sparkled like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her laughter was so alive in his mind, he could almost hear it.

meanings.definition: Full of energy and spirit; lively.
meanings.sent1: The children were alive with joy as they played in the park.
meanings.sent2: The lively music got everyone on their feet dancing.
meanings.sent3: The alive puppy bounced around the room, full of energy.
meanings.sent4: Her words were so alive with passion, they moved the audience to tears.
meanings.sent5: The painting seemed to come alive with vibrant colors and bold strokes.

meanings.definition: In existence; not extinct or destroyed.
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins stood as a reminder that a civilization was once alive here.
meanings.sent2: The tradition of storytelling kept the culture alive for generations.
meanings.sent3: The old clock was so alive with ticking, it almost seemed to have a heartbeat.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were alive with the hustle and bustle of daily life.
meanings.sent5: The flame burned so alive, it cast dancing shadows on the walls.
